Assumptions: Approximately 45 % of the vast area of tropical peatlands in South-East Asia has been deforested in the past 50 years (page 159)
In 2015, 29% (4.6 Mha) of the peatlands in the study area remain covered by peat swamp forest (vs. 41% or 6.4 Mha in 2007 and 76% or 11.9 Mha in 1990).
